content: It seems that I've once again lost merge permissions on rust-lang/rfcs. cc @simulacrum since this happened before when I tried to merge the inline asm RFC.
@Amanieu hm, you should have permissions.
can you tell me what the error is/what you're seeing?
Oh nevermind it seems that it just needed to be approved.
Bleh I messed up the merge. Can someone quickly approve https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/2986?
Since I don't have permissions to push directly to the master branch I had to push the fixup commit directly to the PR branch. I got mixed up with my remotes and accidentally deleted everything.
We can probably just drop the branch protection stuff, it's really only there as a safeguard
Everyone who usually merges PRs ignores the branch protection and push directly to master anyways. In fact pushing to master is explicitly in the RFC merge procedure on the forge.
I think libs team does have rights to push
No, I don't have permissions to bypass the branch protection. All changes to master have to go through a PR.
ah "Required status checks will still prevent these people, teams and apps from merging if the checks fail. "
